Prompts

Journaling Prompts for every day

Last Updated: June 11, 2025

Journaling prompts to use for 2025. Ideas to get you started with a regular journaling practice. You can answer in as much or as little detail as you like. This is just for if you struggle to think of things to write about or like a guided approach for each day.

Each month’s prompts will be added as it approaches.

January
  1. What is something you want to leave behind in 2024 and bring into 2025?
  2. How do you define personal growth, and what does it look like for you this year?
  3. What is the best way you could start your morning today?
  4. What is a piece of advice you received that you want to remember this year?
  5. If you could collect one thing, what would it be, and why?
  6. How do you prioritize your tasks when life gets overwhelming?
  7. What is something about your childhood that makes you smile?
  8. What is a hobby or skill you’d like to start this year?
  9. What does “freedom” mean to you in your everyday life?
  10. If you could improve one habit, what would it be?
  11. What is your favorite place to spend time outdoors, and why?
  12. How do you handle unexpected changes to your plans?
  13. What is a cause or issue you deeply care about?
  14. How do you stay hopeful when things feel difficult?
  15. What is a small act of self-care you can do today?
  16. What does “living authentically” mean to you, and are you doing it?
  17. What is a comfort food or drink you always turn to?
  18. How do you decide when to take a break?
  19. What is something small that made you smile today?
  20. How do you handle regrets from the past?
  21. What is one trait you admire in others and want to develop yourself?
  22. How do you decide what kind of person you want to be this year?
  23. What is your favorite way to unwind at the end of the day?
  24. What does “kindness” mean to you, and how do you practice it?
  25. How do you define “success” for yourself?
  26. What is something you’ve learned from a mistake in the past?
  27. What is a color that makes you feel calm or happy?
  28. How do you keep track of ideas or inspirations?
  29. What is one thing you’d like to simplify in your life?
  30. How do you decide what to let go of in your life?
  31. What is one thing you’d like to do differently next month?

February
  1. Name a daily habit that brings you a little joy.
  2. Think back to the last time you were interrupted—how did you handle it?
  3. Describe your perfect Saturday morning in three sentences.
  4. What’s a task you’d gladly hand off or ask for help with?
  5. Share something new you’ve tried recently and how it turned out.
  6. How will you celebrate or show love this month?
  7. Reflect on a recent goal you achieved.
  8. Is there anything you’ve decluttered lately, or want to tackle soon?
  9. When faced with uncertainty, what tools help you make decisions?
  10. Write about your favorite thing to do when you’re not feeling well.
  11. How do you celebrate when you finish a big project?
  12. What’s a personal strength you’re proud of and want to use more often?
  13. How have you made your space feel cozy or inviting?
  14. What’s a small way you show someone you care?
  15. What’s something new you’ve discovered about yourself this month?
  16. How do you quiet self-doubt when it pops up?
  17. What scent brings you comfort or makes you feel at home?
  18. In your own words, what does “peace of mind” mean?
  19. Is there a task you’ve been putting off? What’s stopping you?
  20. How do you typically spend your lunch or break time?
  21. Write down one simple thing you can do today to make tomorrow better.
  22. How do you know when a relationship is successful?
  23. What’s a recent small win you feel proud of?
  24. How do you make time for fun in your daily life?
  25. What’s one way you’ve cared for yourself recently?
  26. Recall a random act of kindness—either something you did or witnessed.
  27. What’s a treat or indulgence that always brightens your day?
  28. When was the last time you truly felt present, and what were you doing?

March
  1. What’s something new you’d love to learn this year, and what’s the first small step toward it?
  2. When your plans go off track, what’s your go-to way to reset or adapt?
  3. Think back to a moment last week that made you smile—what happened?
  4. What’s a self-care habit that actually fits into your daily routine?
  5. What’s something you’ve let go of recently that felt like a relief?
  6. If you could dedicate a whole day to one hobby or passion, how would you spend it?
  7. What’s a fun way you’d like to celebrate a recent win—big or small?
  8. When was the last time you did something that made you feel genuinely proud?
  9. What’s a recipe or food you’ve been curious to try making?
  10. How does your morning routine set the tone for your day? Would you change anything?
  11. What’s one change you’ve been considering but haven’t made yet?
  12. When you start feeling overwhelmed, what’s something that helps you reset?
  13. What’s a memory of a friend or mentor that always makes you feel inspired?
  14. What’s something unique or special about you?
  15. If you had an extra hour in your day, how would you use it?
  16. What are your ideal pizza toppings?
  17. When was the last time you felt a strong sense of connection to a group or community?
  18. How do you process feedback—do you take it in easily, or does it take time?
  19. What’s a simple pleasure that always makes your day better?
  20. What’s one sign that tells you it’s time to rest and recharge?
  21. If you could start a personal tradition or ritual, what would it be?
  22. Do you track your goals or prefer to go with the flow? What works best for you?
  23. What’s a piece of advice you wish you’d believed sooner?
  24. How do you feel about stepping outside your comfort zone?
  25. What’s a small luxury that makes life feel a little more special?
  26. What’s a book, show, or movie that’s really stuck with you lately?
  27. If you could revisit any place you’ve been, where would you go and why?
  28. What’s something you’re looking forward to in the next few weeks?
  29. If your ideal day had a theme, what would it be?
  30. What’s one word that describes how you want to feel next month?

April
  1. What is a new routine or habit you’ve started this year?
  2. How do you approach solving a recurring problem in your life?
  3. What is one thing about your home that you’re grateful for?
  4. What’s your ideal vacation?
  5. What is a skill you’ve been wanting to improve?
  6. How do you handle being out of your comfort zone?
  7. What is a recipe or meal that reminds you of home?
  8. How do you celebrate milestones in your life, big or small?
  9. What’s something unexpected that made you laugh recently?
  10. What are some creative ways you stay connected with others during busy times?
  11. What is a small item or token that holds great value to you?
  12. What would your ideal “lazy day” look like from start to finish?
  13. What is something about springtime that brings you joy?
  14. What is a favorite outdoor activity you enjoy?
  15. When something doesn’t go your way, how do you usually bounce back?
  16. What is something you’re grateful for today?
  17. How do you show appreciation to the people in your life?
  18. What’s your favorite seasoning to add to food?
  19. What is a hobby or pastime you’d like to try this year?
  20. What’s your favorite movie genre?
  21. What’s a quote or phrase that’s resonated with you lately?
  22. How do you decide what’s worth your time and energy?
  23. What is something you’ve achieved recently that felt rewarding?
  24. What’s a small fear or hesitation you’re working to overcome?
  25. What’s your favorite way to recharge after a long week?
  26. What is a smell, sound, or sight that instantly makes you feel calm?
  27. Where do you keep your creative ideas—and how do you revisit them?
  28. What’s something memorable a friend or mentor has taught you?
  29. What’s your favorite vegetable?
  30. If this season had a soundtrack, what would be the first song on it?

May
  1. How do you stay present during everyday tasks?
  2. What’s one area of your life that feels organized or in control?
  3. What’s your favorite way to spend a sunny day?
  4. How do you approach big decisions?
  5. What’s a favorite memory you associate with summertime?
  6. What snack always improves your mood, no matter what?
  7. What’s your favorite thing to wear when you want to feel confident or cozy?
  8. If your day had a theme song, what would it be today?
  9. What’s something you could let go of to feel lighter?
  10. What’s your go-to silly little treat or indulgence?
  11. What’s something new you’ve added to your home that brings you joy?
  12. How do you decide which risks are worth taking?
  13. What’s something you enjoy doing on your own?
  14. Which fictional character do you wish you could be friends with right now?
  15. What game, hobby, or playful activity brings out your inner kid?
  16. What sound, smell, or sight reminds you of summer?
  17. How do you navigate feeling stuck or uninspired?
  18. What project or task are you excited to work on?
  19. How do you stay in touch with what truly matters to you?
  20. What’s a favorite activity you loved as a child?
  21. What’s your ideal way to spend a completely responsibility-free day?
  22. What book, song, or quote is inspiring you lately?
  23. What’s something random you love talking about way too much?
  24. What was your favorite snack, outfit, or show when you were 10 years old?
  25. How do you know when it’s time to celebrate your progress?
  26. What’s a recent decision you’re proud of?
  27. How do you handle days when nothing goes as planned?
  28. What’s one thing you’ve been meaning to improve in your daily routine?
  29. If next month had a vibe, what would you want it to be? (Color, mood, song, etc.)
  30. In what way have you grown since last spring?
  31. What’s your personal version of a “reset button” when you’re feeling off?

June
  1. What is one thing you’re genuinely excited about this summer?
  2. How do you stay focused when the world around you is screaming “distraction”?
  3. What’s a recent conversation that made you laugh, think, or both?
  4. What’s your personal “oops I forgot” category — birthdays, bills, appointments, or something else?
  5. What food or drink instantly gives you that summer feeling?
  6. What’s a social setting where you’re thriving… and one where you’re looking for the exit?
  7. What’s a small, kind thing you did (or saw) recently?
  8. What’s one of your favorite water memories — lakes, puddles, pools, whatever floats?
  9. When something good happens, what’s your go-to way to celebrate? (Cake? Dance party? Telling your cat?)
  10. What’s your ideal way to unwind on a warm evening?
  11. What little things test your patience the most? (Bonus: Do you have any silly tricks that actually help?)
  12. What’s a piece of art, music, or writing that’s caught your attention lately?
  13. When you’re stuck between two choices, what usually helps you decide?
  14. What’s something new you’ve realized about yourself this year?
  15. What’s your organization style: color-coded planner, digital chaos, or “it’s in my head, I swear”?
  16. What’s an outdoor activity that helps you feel a little more human again?
  17. How do you catch yourself in the act of enjoying something — before it zooms past?
  18. What’s a goal you dropped that might deserve another shot?
  19. What does your summer morning routine actually look like (vs. the dream version)?
  20. What’s your favorite way to spend a quiet afternoon — indoors or out?
  21. What tends to refill your creative tank when it’s running on fumes?
  22. What’s one part of your daily life you’d love to simplify?
  23. What counts as a win in your book — fresh laundry folded? Remembering your water bottle?
  24. If you could invent a summer ritual or tradition just for you, what would it be?
  25. What’s a little moment from today that made you smile?
  26. What’s something you’ve done lately that even you didn’t see coming?
  27. What’s your gut reaction to getting advice — intrigued, annoyed, or “thanks but I already Googled it”?
  28. What smell, sound, or taste instantly reminds you of summer?
  29. How do you plan a weekend that’s both productive and chill?
  30. What’s something you’re weirdly excited to start in the second half of the year?

July
  1. What does independence mean to you in your everyday life (even in small ways)?
  2. What's your go-to pick-me-up when it's sweltering outside?
  3. What’s a favorite way you’ve celebrated a summer holiday or event?
  4. How do you make a little time for personal reflection, even on busy days?
  5. When’s the last time you did something a little out of your comfort zone—maybe something summery or spontaneous?
  6. How do you choose what actually matters on a high‑energy summer day?
  7. What’s a favorite memory of fireworks, parades, or summer celebrations?
  8. When doubts sneak in (especially on low‑energy days), what helps you regroup or reset?
  9. What hobby or interest have you been enjoying lately—just for yourself?
  10. What kind of advice do you actually find helpful—and what kind drives you a little nuts?
  11. Do you prefer reading physical books or eBooks—and why?
  12. What’s one easy way you bring calm into a stressful day?
  13. What’s something nature has “taught” you lately (even just from a walk or a glance outside)?
  14. How do you set the tone for your week ahead—intentionally or accidentally?
  15. If your life this month was a summer movie, what genre would it be? Comedy? Drama? Road trip adventure?
  16. What helps you stay cool—physically and emotionally—in the summer heat?
  17. Have you added anything new to your routine recently that’s helped, even a little?
  18. What’s your favorite way to recharge after a productive or chaotic day?
  19. What does a “weekend treat” look like for you in summer?
  20. Looking back over the last few months, what’s something fun or unexpected you’ve learned?
  21. Is there a space or stash you’ve been meaning to tidy up? (Even thinking about it counts!)
  22. What’s one creative or lighthearted way you’ve solved a small problem lately?
  23. What’s brought you surprise joy this year so far?
  24. How do you celebrate other people’s wins—even quietly?
  25. What’s something silly, fun, or oddly specific you’d like to do before the month ends?
  26. What’s your favorite way to enjoy being outside in summer: beach, shade, bugs, snacks?
  27. What’s something you’re pretty good at that could help you this month?
  28. What’s one small thing that made you smile this week?
  29. What’s a summer activity that always makes you feel like yourself?
  30. How do you like to get ready for a new month—any little rituals or habits?
  31. What’s a subtle way you’ve grown lately, even if no one else noticed?

August
  1. What’s the last app you opened on your phone, and why?
  2. If you had to give your current mood a weather report, what would it be?
  3. What’s the weirdest snack combo you genuinely enjoy?
  4. What’s a small hill you’re absolutely willing to die on?
  5. If you could instantly master any skill for 24 hours, what would you pick?
  6. When was the last time you laughed so hard you couldn’t breathe?
  7. What’s your personal “comfy clothes” uniform?
  8. If you could rename one everyday object to something sillier, what would you call it?
  9. What’s the most recent thing you googled?
  10. If your day today was a playlist, what would the first three songs be?
  11. What’s your most irrational fear that you know is silly but still have?
  12. If you could swap lives with a fictional character for one day, who would it be?
  13. What’s your current “comfort rewatch” TV show, movie, or YouTube channel?
  14. If you had to eat only foods that start with one letter for the day, what letter would you choose?
  15. What’s your most-used emoji, and does it actually fit your personality?
  16. If you were a candle scent, what would be in your blend?
  17. What’s the most recent piece of advice you’ve completely ignored?
  18. What’s your go-to response when someone asks, “How’s it going?”
  19. If your phone background could tell a story, what would it say about you?
  20. What’s one harmless conspiracy theory you secretly find funny or believable?
  21. If you had to wear one color every day for a year, which would you choose?
  22. What’s the weirdest compliment you’ve ever received?
  23. If you had a secret handshake with yourself, what would it look like?
  24. Which fictional universe would you happily retire in?
  25. What’s the most “you” thing you’ve done this month?
  26. If you had to name your autobiography after a lyric from a song, what would it be?
  27. What’s your most overused phrase right now?
  28. Which everyday object would you enchant to have magical powers?
  29. What’s your current irrational craving?
  30. If your life right now had a tagline, what would it be?
  31. What’s a tiny, ridiculous thing that always makes your day better?
